com.sri.kernel.srml
Interface SRMLElement

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultSRMLElement
public interface SRMLElement

This class represents an SRML Element. It defines methods used by the SRML parser in parsing SRML elements.SRML (Smart Robots Markup Language) is an XML based language used to communicate with the robot. It is meant to be an intermediate language that is both human and robot readable. The SRML language set is dynamic. Elements can be added and removed at runtime. This allows modules to provide a set of SRML elements which are incorporated into the SRML language engine when the module is loaded.

All SRML Elements are implemented by a module and should be accessed through the DefaultSRMLElement class, which provides basic functionality to the SRMLElement interface. This is usually done in an inner class of a module to provide the SRMLELement with functionality provided by the module.

SRML Elements can also have a set of attributes, which are name-value pairs within the start tag of an element. Attributes within SRML Elements are parsed by calling corresponding method calls within the SRML Element. The format for naming method used when parsing element attributes is this: 

    public void SRMLset[attribute name](String value);
In this, [attribute name] is the name of the attributed used. The first letter of the attribute is capitalized, while the remainder is lower case. For instance, if the attribute "text" was used like this: 
    <echo text="hello world"/>
Then the following method within the Echo SRML Element will be used: 
    public void SRMLsetText(String value);

Version:
1.5
Author:
Joseph Monti, Smart Robots

Method Detail

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
This method should return the name of the element as written in SRML. If this SRML Element were to provide the echo element, this method would return "echo".

Returns:
The name of the element as written in SRML.

newInstance

public SRMLElement newInstance()
This is called when a new element matching getName() is found. The returned SRMLElement is used to parse the new element. For instance, if this SRML Element was SRMLEcho, this class would return new SRMEcho();

Returns:
A new instance of this class.

init

public void init()
Called to initialize any data needed by the element.

execute

public java.lang.String execute()
Called when the end tag has been encountered. At this point any attributs or nested text for this element would have been processed.

Returns:
A string to be returned by the element.

processText

public void processText(java.lang.String s)
This is called when nested text has been found. If for instance, there is the SRML "<echo>Hello World</echo>", the text "Hello World" will be sent to this method.

Parameters:
s - The nested text.

selfParses

public boolean selfParses()
This should return true if the SRML Element self parses.

Returns:
true if self parses, false otherwise
See Also:
parse(KXmlParser parser)

parse

public java.lang.String parse(org.kxml2.io.KXmlParser parser)
                       throws SRMLParsingException
This method is called if selfParses() returns true. It is sent the KXmlParser that is being used to parse the current document. It allows an SRML Element to take over the XML parsing process. This should only be used with a thourough understanding of XML Pull Parsing, found here, and KXml, found here.

The SRML Parser expects this to return having not parsed beyond the end tag of this element. The results of improperly parsing with this method are undefined and can cause catestrophic errors. So beware of using this method.

This method is provided to allow for more advanced functionality in the SRML language. This is used in the loop element to allow repeated execution of the nested elements and text.

When an element self parses the execute() method will not be used, in its place this method will be used.

Parameters:
parser - The KXml parser being used to parse the current document.
Returns:
A string to be returned by the element. Similar to the return of execute().
Throws:
SRMLParsingException
